page.title: 20Sudbury's Market
page.content: Sudbury has had a market since Saxon times but its site moved from Stour Street to its present position on Market Hill in the Middle Ages. Market Hill is the centre of the modern town and there are two market days per week, Thursday and Saturday where a variety of goods are sold from stalls. There is a livestock market situated in Burkitts Lane. This used to be the most important part of the market but it could close down next year because it has few customers. There is a flourishing second hand market on the same site which will remain. --------------------------------------- PRODUCED BY: Sudbury Upper School - Miss L.Tayler.
